file_content.text: I suppose he's not here for his charm.
I've got Imperial walkers about to hit this village and no defenses to stop them. Send a lot of men with guns!
Hold out as long as you can. My crew and I will head for the surface immediately.
Just stay calm....
They must have run out of targets. Or this village is really a secret Republic base.
Walkers? Seriously?
Sounds like this is my fight. You can stay here and... roll bandages, or something.
Good thing I'm here.
This isn't our first op, you know.
Retaking a planet shouldn't mean destroying it. Has the fighting been that bad?
What do you mean?
For years, it seemed we were fighting a losing battle. I'm glad that's changed.
Finally, a victory.
Maybe you should take over. I have a feeling you're better than Doc at a lot of things.
[Flirt] Is that so?
We all know basic first aid. I only keep Doc around for entertainment.
He's an idiot, it's true.
Doc's been with me since Balmorra. He's a little unorthodox, but I trust his judgment.
Doc does fine.
You can't be serious. Master Jedi, no decent medical facility would let him through the door.
If you're trying to make me jealous, boy, it is not working.
And I'm surprisingly with Doc.
Of course I am. But so are trained apes.
Look, I'm irresistible. It's only natural you want to be around me. But this is too much!
What's going on?
I'm your chief medic. Me. Not her. She's been nosing around the medbay, touching my stuff....
I'll remember that the next time you lose a toe.
If you think you can do better, Audra, you can examine me whenever you want.
[Flirt] Is that so?
I may hold you to that.
All right, people, listen up. I've got the numbers on Bothawui, and they're... big. Bigger than anything we've done before.
The Empire's not leaving quietly. If they can't take it with them, they're getting rid of it--and that includes the Bothan people.
...and get those barricades in position! Whoever you are, get off this channel! We've got an emergency down here!
Captain Maddox, of the Protectors. We're trained to respond to emergency situations. Tell us how we can help.
Is that a joke? Is the Jedi laughing?
Be fast. Hey! Don't waste that kolto--that's all we have....
They'll need you before they need us. We'll get supplies and personnel together and follow you down.
This world could feed half the Republic. Billions live here, and the Supreme Chancellor's trusting us with their lives.
I thought the Imps got Bothawui in the treaty. We're not here to free the whole planet, are we?
Republic soldiers just get in my way. I can handle anything the Empire throws at us.
We don't need help.
I'm counting on it.
The more time we waste here, the worse things will get. Where do we start?
Then let's get moving.
Protection of civilians should be the military's top priority, no matter who has the upper hand.
Our troops should be helping.
Legius is the one who threatened your work. Has there been any sign of him?
Any Sith presence?
Not a flash. We'll just have to keep our eyes open.
And our weapons armed.
The resistance will be our guide. They control a village outside Imperial territory where we can set up base. I'll contact them now.
Garith, get your civilians under cover and do not engage. We'll be there as soon as we can.
Why shouldn't I be down there? You clearly need adult supervision.
Burned fields, flooded villages, slavers and death camps... Command sent holo-images, but you're better off without.
Our troops have a war to fight. Local resistance is overwhelmed. It's our job to pick up the slack and keep the Bothans safe.
Victory must come first, or there will be none to protect.
Official strategy is to hit high-priority targets first. Not our decision, anyhow.
Our military's already got the Imps on the run. We're here to make sure they end up with more than a burned-out husk.
Just wish the price wasn't so dear.
